intro: Chrysanthemum frutescens var. gracilescens, commonly known as the slender chrysanthemum, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are hairy and arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
